text: How to cook mulled wine - fragrant, tart, warming 04 Nov 2019, 13:00 by Irina Rogava, Daria Rodionova Just a few minutes separate you from the perfect drink. What mulled wine is made of Mulled wine is a heated red wine with sugar and spices. This is the basis. And you can experiment with it. The main thing is not to forget about a few rules. What you can‚Äôt do without Most often, dry or semi-dry wine is used. Such mulled wine is more tart and harsh. But semi-sweet gives the drink a velvety taste. Sugar can be replaced with honey if desired. He will award the drink with a light characteristic aroma. Of the spices in mulled wine, cinnamon, cloves, ginger, star anise and citrus peels are usually put - mostly lemon. What can be added For the sake of a richer taste and aroma, mulled wine is added with nutmeg, cardamom, allspice and black pepper and even bay leaf. Quite often, fruit slices are used to make a drink: apples, lemon and orange. You can also put raisins, dried barberries, cranberries and nuts. Another common ingredient is juice. Usually they take orange, apple, cranberry or cherry. Fans of experiments can add coffee, black tea, cognac or rum to mulled wine. What combination of ingredients will definitely like Life hacker made wonderful mulled wine from these products: 2 tablespoons of sugar; 1 teaspoon of cinnamon; ¬Ω lemon; 1 apple 2-3 cm of ginger root; 750 ml of semi-sweet red wine; 250 ml apple juice; 2-3 cinnamon sticks; 2-3 grains of cardamom; 1-2 buds of cloves; 3 peas of allspice. How to make mulled wine Pour sugar into a small bowl and mix with cinnamon. If you use honey, leave it for later. Honey is added to the pan at the very end of preparation or to glasses with a drink already spilled. Remove the peel from the lemon and cut the flesh into circles. Chopped washed apple, too, in large pieces. Peel the ginger root. It‚Äôs faster and easier to do this with a teaspoon, scraping it with a skin. Cut the ginger into thin slices. Pour red wine and apple juice into the pan. Put on a slow fire and add the flesh of a lemon, citrus peels and apples. Put a mixture of sugar and ground cinnamon (or just cinnamon if you use honey), ginger, cinnamon sticks, cardamom, cloves and allspice. Heat the wine to 70‚Äì80 ¬∞ –°: steam will appear above the pan, and you will hear something like a gurgle. Mulled wine cannot be boiled, otherwise the taste of wine will evaporate with the liquid. Cover the drink with a lid and remove from heat. To keep the heat longer, you can wrap the pan with a towel. Insist 10-15 minutes or a little longer. Strain the mulled wine with a sieve or gauze. By the way, there is another way of cooking. Bring 150-200 ml of water to a boil in a saucepan, lay spices and boil for 10 minutes. After that, add fruit, juice and wine to the aromatic water. How to serve mulled wine This drink is hot. Ideally, it should be poured into tall glass goblets of thick glass. In such dishes, mulled wine will cool more slowly. Before serving, the drink can be decorated. For example, put inside a cinnamon stick, star anise anise, a slice of lemon or orange, berries. Or stick a clove in a circle of citrus and put it on the edge of the glass.
